Data Structures

class  CustomFrameBuffer

Detailed Description

Provides methods for accessing the display in a generic way. For the application developer it is recommended to use the class DeviceContext for drawing operations. Using the display device directly is possible but it is important to know, that this approach bypasses the APOXI window system.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum Display::BacklightMode
 

Defines the mode for the backlight, which can be set by Display::SetBacklightMode.

Enumerator:
BacklightModeOff  Backlight is continuously off.
BacklightModeAuto  Backlight is on as long ReactivateBacklight is called and turns off automatically after the adjusted timeout given by SetBacklightTimeout.
BacklightModeOn  Backlight is continuously on.

enum Display::Info
 

The message DisplayInfoMsg will be posted to the system with one of the following parameters as soon as the backlight or the power state changes:

Enumerator:
PowerTurnedOn 
PowerTurnedOff 
BacklightTurnedOn 
BacklightTurnedOff 
DisplayTimeout 

enum Display::PowerMode
 

Defines the mode for the power handling, which can be set by Display::SetPowerMode.

Enumerator:
PowerModeOff  Power is continuously off.
PowerModeAuto  Power is on as long ReactivatePower is called and turns off automatically after the adjusted timeout given by SetPowerTimeout. Note that the Power is on as long the backlight is on.
PowerModeOn  Power is continuously on.

VideoChannel * Display::GetVideoChannel (   )  [virtual]
 

Returns a pointer to the video channel. It depends on the implementation of the device, whether a video channel is supported.

See also:

Reimplemented in DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, and DefaultDisplay.

void Display::IndicateAlphaMaskUpdate (   )  [virtual]
 

Indicates that the alpha mask which is used for blending the video channel with the display content (see Display::Refresh) might have changed. Per default this method is invoked by APOXI whenever a window is opened, closed, resized or moved. This method is useful for companion chips which do the alpha-blending itself: the updated alpha-mask should be transferred to the companion chip within this method. If no companion chip is used the implementation of this method can be empty, as the blending of the alpha-mask with the video-channel is done in each Display::Refresh.

void Display::ReactivateBacklight (   )  [virtual]
 

Call this method for example on each key press to turn on the backlight. Then it automatically turns off the display backlight after the adjusted timeout.

Reimplemented in DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, and DefaultDisplay.

void Display::ReactivatePower (   )  [virtual]
 

Call this method as long as you want to keep the display powered on. When you stop calling that method the power turns off automatically after the adjusted timeout. Note that ReactivatPower will be called internally as long as the backlight is on.

Reimplemented in DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, and DefaultDisplay.

void Display::Refresh (  BOOLEAN  block,
const CustomFrameBuffer *  custom_frame_buf = 0
) 
 

Obsolete - provided for backward compatibility (The parameter block will be ignored). Use Display::Refresh(const CustomFrameBuffer* custom_frame_buf) instead.

void Display::Refresh (  const CustomFrameBuffer *  custom_frame_buf  )  [virtual]
 

Refreshes the display area specified by the blitting-rectangle (see Display::SetBlitRect and Display::GetBlitRect). Whether the refreshing is done synchronous or asynchronous, depends on the capabilities of the low-level display device. Per default APOXI does not block when refreshing the display, hence block is set to FALSE. If the update should be done synchronous, set block to TRUE and APOXI will wait until the low-level display device has finished the refreshing.

Parameters:
custom_frame_buf Optional parameter which allows to pass a custom frame buffer for refreshing instead of using the internal frame buffer.

void Display::Refresh (   )  [virtual]
 

See also:
VirtualDisplay::Refresh

void Display::SetCustomFrameBufferRect (  const Rect &  rect  )  [virtual]
 

Sets the boundaries of the custom frame buffer. A custom frame buffer can be passed with the method Display::Refresh. The boundaries must be consistent with the passed frame buffer. If no custom frame buffer will be used anymore, Display::SetCustomFrameBufferRect(Rect()) must be invoked.

Reimplemented in DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, and DefaultDisplay.

void Display::SetLocked (  BOOLEAN  locked  )  [inline]
 

If locked is TRUE, the refreshing of the display will be locked until Display::SetLocked(FALSE) is invoked. Nothing is blocked, just the refreshing will be skipped.

See also:
Display::Refresh

mode See Display::PowerMode.

void Display::SetPowerTimeout (  UINT32  timeout  )  [virtual]
 

Parameters:
timeout Timeout value in milliseconds. After this time without calling ReactivatePower the power turns off.

Reimplemented in DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, DefaultDisplay, and DefaultDisplay.
